snippet: A City Council bill is part of a national campaign by elected officials, legal scholars and tenant advocates to establish a right to counsel in civil actions that affect basic needs like housing.
abstract: New York City Council bill, part of national campaign to establish right to counsel in civil actions that impact basic needs like housing, would require city to spend more than $100 million on legal aid to fight evictions; with de Blasio administration stepping up efforts to keep tenants in their rent-regulated apartments as part of an affordable housing strategy, lack of counsel in Housing Court has drawn significant attention.
lead_paragraph: A City Council bill is part of a national campaign by elected officials, legal scholars and tenant advocates to establish a right to counsel in civil actions that affect basic needs like housing.

headline.main: Push to Provide Lawyers in New York City Housing Court Gains Momentum
headline.print_headline: Support Builds for a Push to Provide Tenants With Lawyers in Housing Court
